title: Astra blames launch failure on wiring error and software flaw
summary: Astra Space said March 7 it identified two problems that led to the failure of a launch last month as the company gears up for a new launch that may be imminent.

title: SpaceX Starbase facilities already taking advantage of new “Port Connector Road”

title: SpaceX worked for weeks to begin Starlink service in Ukraine
summary: SpaceX’s president says the company had been working for weeks to secure approval for Starlink services in Ukraine before a government minister tweeted a request to Elon Musk.

title: Beames becomes SpiderOak’s chairman of the board
summary: SmallSat Alliance Chairman Charles Beames is taking the helm of cybersecurity firm SpiderOak as chairman of the board.

title: Intelsat picks David Wajsgras as next CEO
summary: Intelsat has picked former Raytheon executive David Wajsgras as CEO to lead the satellite operator post-bankruptcy.

title: How to save the International Space Station and prevent the dreaded “gap”
summary: Unity in space remains in the best interest of the international partners.

title: SpaceX on track for fourth Starlink launch in two weeks

title: China launches test satellites for broadband constellation
summary: China  launched a set of commercial satellites Saturday for testing broadband services, on-orbit networking and integrating communications and remote sensing technologies.

title: SpaceX’s first Jupiter launch a step closer as NASA begins assembling ‘Europa Clipper’

title: DoD wants ‘resilient’ space systems, but how to get there is still unclear
summary: What it will take to make DoD constellations more resilient and achieve space superiority is still being debated, industry executives said.
